intro: Neotanahashia, commonly known as the desert milkweed, is a perennial plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the milkweed family (Asclepiadaceae) and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, yellowish-orange flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains latex, which is a common feature among members of its family. Neotanahashia thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, contributing to its ecological importance in desert ecosystems.
